reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location, the public areas, the reception, restaurant were fantastic, it was plain to see why it is called 'Grande'. The rooms were as described in various guides, 'functional'. Nothing spectacular but was clean and everything we need were there, and also quite spacious so we were pretty happy. Thought it may be noisy in the evening but rooms were located away from the main street and was quiet. Great location to get around in the city too. There was a small terrace on the 3rd Floor, shame there was no bar there.
reviews.title: We were not disappointed!

reviews.text: We had only 24 hours in Porto, and this hotel's central location and professional staff made our time there both enjoyable and productive. We arrived in the morning before our room was ready, but we were checked in and our bags whisked safely away in moments, and given a handy map to the city. After a four- or five-hour walking tour of all the main sights, plus some wine tasting across the river, we returned to the hotel where our bags had already been placed in the room. As others have said, the public areas of the hotel are very grand, in an opulent 19th-century sort of way. The rooms are plain and utilitarian, but ours was quite and had a great bathroom, and was scrupulously clean, so we were happy. Great breakfast was included in our rate; I recommend it if you are a breakfast-lover. All-around great hotel for a quick visit to Porto.
reviews.title: Perfect for seeing main sights of Porto, especially on a short timeline

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a week, the plus points were the hotel was very clean, comfortable, central, the breakfast was served until 10.30 every day, bonus is you don''t like early starts and there was plenty of food until that time. The food in the restaurant was best quality we ate in Porto and again was less expensive than many. Two courses bottle of Vinho Verde (7Euros) and water were about 50 Euros we paid 74 in another place and was not such good quality.
reviews.title: Hotel was great really liked it

reviews.text: The only down side was we couldn't understand why the restauarant was so empty in evening so there was not much atomsphere. But we don't think people knew about it,. there were no menus in the rooms or indications of the evening menu in the foyer you had to go and look for it. A shame for the staff really. we would recomend trying the food.
reviews.title: Great Location and staff

reviews.text: The hotel location is great, and the staff is very helpful. The breakfast has a lot of variety. At first, the room that was destined to us was not very good, and the staff changed it twice until it was at our pleasure. The staff alwyas gave us good tips of restaurants and where to get everything we needed.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, excellent value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were in Porto for three nights, just to have a good time and soak up some sun.
reviews.title: A beautiful, comfortable and friendly place

reviews.text: We booked last Friday after checking out the weather forecast which stated sun, sun and sun! We arrived around noon at the hotel. The people at the check-in were really cheerful and we had a short chat about the goals of our stay in Porto. Since my wife has a different surname than mine we told them that we are not married but that we are together for almost 30 years.
reviews.title: Well worth a stay

reviews.text: We had a fun afternoon in in the old town (just around the corner) and decided to go back to the hotel to fresh up before dinner. There was a plate of fresh fruit and a bottle of bubbles waiting for us at our room. After informing this proved to be a gift from the gentleman that helped us during the check in. (I guess it's not standard...)
reviews.title: Sadly the look was better than the experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has been redecorated some year ago in a very tasteful way. Especially the lounges/bar area is a real treat! The barman's English is not very well but he's very helpful and made the necessary workarounds to answer our questions about clubbing in Porto.
reviews.title: 18th visit in four years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can understand that the employees of this nicely upgraded place feel a certain pride which can easily been mistaken for arrogance. We know where to stay when we visit Porto again!
reviews.title: another great stay

reviews.text: The hotel is very nice, located in the city center of Porto, close to all the main attractions.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and staff

reviews.text: The hotel staff is fantastic, very nice and helpful, specially bellboy and the person who takes care of the parking.
reviews.title: Great staff, nice setting, excellent location

reviews.text: Good value for money, I definitely recommend it
reviews.title: Great location, very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very polite and friendly, but also efficient: checking in just took a minute. The lobby and dinner room will set you back into a 19th century colonial mansion, with big plush sofas, chandeliers, marble columns, and so on -- everything nicely renovated and cared for. Our room was clean and comfortable, we stayed with 2 children under 4 and there was no problem at all.
reviews.title: Classy and affordable in the heart of Porto

reviews.text: Dinner was great with a big variety of carefully composed dishes. You will find better food in an upscale restaurant, but the server, the setting, and the low price made up for it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Historic building in the centre of Porto, this is a hotel with outstanding entrance lobby and breakfast/ dinning room, very relaxing !
reviews.title: Grand hotel !

reviews.text: Classic room on 1st floor, was very nice, clean and quiet - bathroom with bathtub and excellent shower-good water pressure !
reviews.title: Great value small room in the centre of all the sights

reviews.text: Mentioned that was our wedding anniversary, so was nice to find bottle of sparkling wine on ice, with plate of lovely pineapple when we arrived in room ! Nice gesture and much appreciated .
reviews.title: Marvellous old-fashined place

reviews.text: Breakfast included was very good, and room service pleasant and fast .
reviews.title: Disappointing stay

reviews.text: Tip - Get metro from airport( 2 euros ) to bolhao station, then walk up to St catarina rd and turn right - 2 minutes down road on your right side it,s the hotel.
reviews.title: Impressive public rooms and professional service standards
